item.title: JDJ 11 Fame Dhanashree Verma And Yuzvendra Chahal Headed For Divorce - Report - Times Now
item.description:
Dhanashree Verma and Yuzvendra Chahal Facing Divorce - Report

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times Now

The marriage between cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and choreographer Dhanashree Verma may be coming to an end as rumors of a split circulate. Insiders report that divorce proceedings are likely unavoidable, although not yet finalized.

  • Insiders confirm rumors of their separation are true.
  • The couple has unfollowed each other on Instagram and deleted photos of their marriage.
  • Fans express shock and sadness, hoping for reconciliation.
  • The couple married in December 2020 and were previously viewed as a perfect couple.
  • Chahal supported Verma on a dance reality show earlier this year.
The divorce is inevitable, and it's only a matter of time before it becomes official.

As public speculation grows, the fate of their relationship remains uncertain, with fans clinging to hope for a possible reconciliation.

item.title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2: IND crumble again, finish 141/6 at stumps, take 145-run lead - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 2

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar remained unbeaten at stumps, but India crumbled under pressure, finishing the day at 141/6, leading by 145 runs after Australia was dismissed for 181.

  • Rishabh Pant scored a quickfire half-century off 29 balls before being dismissed by Pat Cummins.
  • India struggled throughout the innings with several key players, including Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill, losing their wickets early.
  • Jasprit Bumrah returned to the ground after concerns over his injury, providing a boost to the team.
  • Scott Boland was a standout performer for Australia, taking crucial wickets, including that of Kohli and Gill.
  • India's bowlers, led by Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj, performed well, helping dismiss Australia for 181.
“If Australia don't win in Sydney, they will continue to suffer from a drought of a decade-plus without getting their hands on the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.”

The match remains highly competitive as both teams have significant stakes in the outcome, with India's World Test Championship hopes on the line and Australia seeking redemption in the series.

item.title: Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable' - The Times of India
item.description:
Rishabh Pant breaks 50-year-old record; Sachin Tendulkar hails it as 'truly remarkable'

Published on: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's Rishabh Pant delivered a stunning performance during the fifth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, scoring a rapid 61 runs off 33 balls, which has drawn praise from cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar.

  • Pant scored 61 runs in just 33 balls at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
  • His 29-ball fifty is the second-fastest for India in Test cricket.
  • He became the fastest visiting batter to reach a Test fifty on Australian soil.
  • Sachin Tendulkar praised Pant's innings as 'truly remarkable' on social media.
  • Pant's innings featured six fours and four sixes, showcasing his explosive batting style.
  • Despite Pant's effort, India ended the day at a precarious 141/6 in the match.

On a wicket where the majority of the batters have batted at a SR of 50 or less, @RishabhPant17's knock with a SR of 184 is truly remarkable. He has rattled Australia from ball one. It is always entertaining to watch him bat. What an impactful innings!

Pant's innings proves his capability to significantly impact crucial matches, and he continues to be a key player for India.

item.title: Bus Hits Sourav Ganguly's Daughter Sana's Car, Breaks Looking Glass: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Bus Hits Sourav Ganguly's Daughter Sana's Car, Breaks Looking Glass: Report

Date: January 25, 2025
Source: NDTV

Sana, the daughter of former Indian cricket captain Sourav Ganguly, was involved in a car accident when a bus hit her vehicle on Friday night. Fortunately, she is safe, but the incident caused damage to her car.

  • The accident occurred in the Behala Chowrasta area.
  • The bus driver has been detained by authorities.
  • Sana was sitting in the front seat during the collision.
  • Her car sustained damage, including a broken looking glass.
  • The timely reaction of her driver prevented a more serious accident.
“Sana's car could have overturned but her driver was alert enough to avert a major accident.”

This incident highlights the risks associated with reckless driving.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah departs SCG under injury cloud - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Leaves SCG Due to Injury Concerns

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: ICC Cricket

India's stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah has left the field during the fifth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy due to an injury scare.

  • Bumrah bowled only one over before stepping off the field.
  • He was reportedly clocking speeds down to 125 kph before his exit.
  • After a brief absence, he left in training gear to undergo scans.
  • Indian great Ravi Shastri mentioned there could be significant implications for the series depending on Bumrah's condition.
  • Virat Kohli is now leading the team in Bumrah's absence.
  • Bumrah has achieved 32 wickets across the series, breaking records along the way.
  • He previously missed a year due to a stress fracture and underwent surgery.
“This could have a massive bearing on the series.” - Ravi Shastri

Overall, the team's performance may be affected as they await updates on Bumrah's injury.

item.title: LIVE: Boland and Webster bowl Australia back in front at SCG - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Australia Takes Lead in Fifth Border-Gavaskar Test at SCG

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: ICC Cricket

Australia have regained the upper hand in the fifth and final Border-Gavaskar Test against India, with both series honors and a spot in the World Test Championship Final on the line.

  • Australia bowled out for 181 in the second session, India took a slim four-run innings lead.
  • Scott Boland achieved impressive figures of 3/27, dismissing key batsmen including Yashasvi Jaiswal and Virat Kohli.
  • Debutant Beau Webster took his first Test wicket by dismissing Shubman Gill.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah left the match due to injury after taking an early wicket.
  • Steve Smith is approaching a milestone of 10,000 Test runs but remains stranded at 9995 after being dismissed.
“Bumrah's participation in the match is now unclear after his injury.”

This Test is crucial for both teams, with stakes heightened for the World Test Championship.

“Melbourne Renegades to win the match”

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2: AUS 181 all out vs IND at Sydney - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 2

Publication Date: Saturday
Source: Indian Express

On Day 2 of the 5th Test in Sydney, India is in a challenging position with 48 runs for 2 wickets in reply to Australia's 181 at Tea. Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna took three wickets each for India, while Jasprit Bumrah was taken to the hospital after an injury.

  • India took a run lead in the first innings despite struggles in the top order.
  • Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna led the bowling attack for India, each taking three wickets.
  • Jasprit Bumrah had to be hospitalized for scans after bowling just one over after lunch.
  • Beau Webster contributed with a half-century for Australia.
“Rohit Sharma's Test career seems to have hit cross-roads after a conversation with the head coach and chief selector Ajit Agarkar.”

This Test match showcases the intense competition between these two cricketing nations as they fight for supremacy in the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah taken to hospital for scans, Virat Kohli returns as India captain in Sydney - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah's Injury Update Following Hospital Scans

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Jasprit Bumrah left the Sydney Cricket Ground with a niggle during the fifth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and underwent scans at a nearby hospital. The nature of his injury is still uncertain, leading to concerns over his participation in the match.

  • Bumrah left the field on Day 2, prompting Virat Kohli to take over as captain.
  • No official update has been provided regarding the extent of Bumrah's injury.
  • He initially left for a short period but returned to bowl one over before leaving the field again.
  • Substitute Abhimanyu Easwaran replaced him in the field.
  • Bumrah's injury may have significant implications for the Test and the series.
  • He had made history by surpassing the previous record for Indian wicket-takers in Australia during this series.
Bumrah had earlier dismissed Marnus Labuschagne, marking his 32nd wicket of the series, breaking Bishan Singh Bedi's long-standing record.

The situation remains tense for the Indian team as they await further updates on Bumrah's condition, which may determine the outcome of the match.

item.title: 'Oye Konstas! Shots nahi lag rahe kya?': Yashasvi Jaiswal sledges Aussie opener in Hindi; Irfan Pathan got no chill - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Yashasvi Jaiswal Sledges Aussie Opener Sam Konstas in Hindi

Date: Jan 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The ongoing India vs Australia Test match saw Yashasvi Jaiswal mocking Australian opener Sam Konstas during the second day at the Sydney Cricket Ground, adding more spice to the competitive rivalry.

  • Jaiswal engaged Konstas in a sledge, asking in Hindi why he couldn’t see the shots.
  • The incident followed a tense moment between Konstas and Jasprit Bumrah on Day 1.
  • Jaiswal contributed to Konstas’s dismissal later by taking his catch.
  • Australia struggled to maintain their innings, collapsing to 39-4 after early wickets.
“Kya ho gya ab shot nahi dikh rahe kya (What happened? unable to see the shots now?). Oye Konstas, shots nahi lag rahe kya abhi.”

The playful exchange highlights the intense competitive spirit of the match, with Jaiswal's comment bringing laughter from the commentary box.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 2: India's MCG Hero Steps Up After Jasprit Bumrah Leaves Stadium - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test, Day 2: Despite Jasprit Bumrah's Absence, India Dominate Australia To Take 4-Run Lead

Date: 2025-01-04 | Source: NDTV Sports

India has taken a narrow lead of 4 runs against Australia on Day 2 of the 5th Test, after bowling out Australia for 181. With Jasprit Bumrah injured, India's bowling performance was led by Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna, each taking three wickets.

  • India scored 185 runs in their first innings.
  • Australia was bowled out for 181, trailing by 4 runs.
  • Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna stood out with three wickets each.
  • Beau Webster was the top scorer for Australia with 57 runs on his Test debut.
  • Steve Smith contributed with a score of 33 runs.
Rohit Sharma said, "People on the outside sitting with laptop, pen and paper don't decide when retirement will come and what decisions I need to take."

The absence of Jasprit Bumrah presents a significant challenge for India, but they maintain a slight edge going into the next innings, needing to build on this momentum.

item.title: Rohit Sharma To Retire After India vs Australia Series? Star Says: "I Am Father Of 2..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma To Retire After India vs Australia Series? Star Says: "I Am Father Of 2..."

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV Sports

India's captain, Rohit Sharma, has decided to miss the fifth Test against Australia due to poor form, igniting speculation regarding his retirement from Test cricket. At 38, and with India not scheduled for another Test in over five months, this decision raises questions about his future in the sport.

  • Rohit confirmed he is not retiring, stating he wants to focus on the present and continue playing for the team.
  • The decision to rest was taken in agreement with the coach and selectors, citing a need for a strong performance.
  • He emphasized the importance of understanding the team's needs over personal form.
  • Rohit mentioned this is not the end, implying he has more to offer in the future.
“I don’t believe in what happens five months later. I want to focus on the present. This decision is not retirement decision.”

Rohit's decision also allowed for Shubman Gill to step into a key role in the match, highlighting the importance of teamwork in cricket.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah leaves the Sydney Cricket Ground with team doctor - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Leaves SCG Amid Concerns Following Injury

Date: Saturday, Publication Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah left the Sydney Cricket Ground with India's team doctor during a match against Australia, raising concerns about his health after he exited shortly after bowling.

  • Bumrah returned after lunch but bowled only one over before leaving the field.
  • He is being rushed for scans, although there has been no official statement confirming the severity of any injury.
  • During the match, Bumrah took the wicket of Marnus Labuschagne, increasing his series tally to 32—surpassing the previous record held by Bishan Singh Bedi.
  • His performance has been crucial for India, and his absence could significantly impact the team's chances in the match.
"India would hope there is nothing serious because he has been their MVP this series and they can't afford to lose his services midway through the match."

This incident highlights the importance of player health and the potential impact of injuries on team performance.

item.title: 'Jasprit Bumrah Cheater': Australia's New Antics As Indian Skipper Accused Of Using Sand Paper - OneCricket
item.description:
Australia Accuses Jasprit Bumrah of Cheating with Sandpaper

Publication Date: February 2025 | Source: One Cricket News

The cricket rivalry between India and Australia intensifies as allegations arise against Indian skipper Jasprit Bumrah, who is accused of using sandpaper during a Test match.

  • The fifth and final Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy is underway.
  • After initially struggling, India's bowlers, led by Bumrah, bounced back during the match.
  • Australian fans circulated a viral video alleging Bumrah's use of sandpaper to gain an unfair advantage.
  • The video shows Bumrah removing something from his shoe, raising suspicions among Australian supporters.
“The Australian batters are struggling to tackle Bumrah's bowling, leading to suspicions from fans.”

This controversy adds another layer to the already fierce competition between the two cricketing nations and raises questions about sportsmanship in the game.

item.title: "Nonsense...": Rohit Sharma Blasts Sam Konstas Over Clash With Jasprit Bumrah In 5th Test - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Defends Jasprit Bumrah Amidst Controversial Clash with Sam Konstas

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

In a fiery exchange during the ongoing fifth Test against Australia, Rohit Sharma spoke out in defense of Jasprit Bumrah after a heated confrontation with Australian opener Sam Konstas.

  • Rohit Sharma was absent due to injury, handing over captaincy to Bumrah.
  • Jasprit Bumrah lost his composure after comments made by Sam Konstas during the match.
  • Rohit supported Bumrah, stating that Konstas instigated the altercation.
  • The incident sparked a show of unity from the Indian team, highlighting their support for Bumrah.
  • Rohit emphasized the need for players to focus on cricket rather than engage in verbal exchanges.
“Our boys are silent only till a particular time. If you are going to poke them, then they will retaliate. Please don’t do such nonsense.”

The clash underscores the passionate tension in Test cricket, particularly in matches with a rich rivalry like India vs Australia.

item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 2 LIVE Score: Injury scare for Bumrah, good start for AUS after Lunch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test Day 2

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

India vs Australia are locked in a fierce contest during the 5th Test, with both teams vying for vital points. Jasprit Bumrah's injury scare looms large as he has been off the ground after bowling only one over after Lunch.

  • Australia was 101/5 at Lunch, trailing India by 84 runs.
  • Jasprit Bumrah dismissed Marnus Labuschagne early in the day before struggling with fitness.
  • Prasidh Krishna secured key wickets including Steve Smith and Alex Carey.
  • An under-pressure Indian batting line-up, unable to stabilize in their previous innings.
  • The Test match holds significant implications for both teams concerning the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and the World Test Championship.
“An injury to Bumrah is arguably the one thing India dread the most, with the pacer being the visitors' only consistent performer throughout the series.”

The outcome of this match is crucial for both teams, with significant ramifications for future series and rankings.

India's captain, Rohit Sharma, has decided to miss the fifth Test against Australia due to poor form, igniting speculation regarding his retirement from Test cricket. At 38, and with India not scheduled for another Test in over five months, this decision raises questions about his future in the sport.

  • Rohit confirmed he is not retiring, stating he wants to focus on the present and continue playing for the team.

item.title: Rohit Sharma joins Jasprit Bumrah for a quick chat during drinks break at SCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah Chat During Drinks Break at SCG

Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma, despite being dropped from the latest Test, remains a key leader for his team, engaging with teammates during breaks. His reflections on the match highlight the strategic depth of Test cricket.

  • Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah were seen discussing tactics during a drinks break at the SCG.
  • Rohit expressed the importance of patience and pressure maintenance in Test cricket.
  • Despite being dropped, Rohit continues to support his teammates and analyze the game.
  • Rishabh Pant described the decision to drop Rohit as emotional, underscoring his leadership role.
  • Rohit has struggled with performance in recent matches, averaging just 6.2 in his last series against Australia.
“The next session is going to be really crucial, this is what happens in Test cricket. Every session is crucial.” - Rohit Sharma

Rohit Sharma's engagement with the team during challenging times emphasizes his ongoing influence and leadership role within Indian cricket, despite recent performance struggles.

item.title: Sourav Ganguly's daughter Sana unhurt after bus hits her car in Kolkata: Reports - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sana Ganguly Unhurt After Car Accident in Kolkata

Published on: Jan 04, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricket captain Sourav Ganguly's daughter Sana was unhurt after a bus reportedly hit her car at Kolkata's Diamond Harbour Road on Friday evening.

  • The incident occurred in the Behala Chowrasta area.
  • The bus driver sped away but was later detained by the police.
  • Sana informed authorities, leading to a swift police response.
  • Her car sustained minor damage from the collision.
“We want justice, whatever it takes to get it. This has to stop.” - Sana Ganguly

This incident highlights safety concerns on the roads and showcases the prompt action of law enforcement in addressing such accidents.

item.title: "The Baby Bunch": Jasprit Bumrah And Co Targeted By Nasty Assault From Australian Media Yet Again - NDTV Sports
item.description:
The Baby Bunch: Jasprit Bumrah Faces Criticism from Australian Media

Date: January 3, 2025
Source: NDTV

On the first day of the final Test between India and Australia, the Australian media criticized the Indian cricket team, particularly Jasprit Bumrah, after India was bowled out for 185 runs. Emotions ran high, especially during an on-field confrontation between Bumrah and Australian player Sam Konstas.

  • Rohit Sharma did not play due to poor form.
  • Jasprit Bumrah engaged in a heated exchange with Sam Konstas.
  • The Australian media referred to the Indian team as "The Baby Bunch" in a derogatory article.
  • Sanjay Manjrekar praised Bumrah's intensity despite the team's struggles.
“To see him fired up in this fashion is quite rare.” - Sanjay Manjrekar

The criticism from the Australian media highlights the intense rivalry and emotions involved in this final match.

item.title: Virat Kohli asks SCG crowd to roar after Mohammed Siraj sends Sam Konstas packing at SCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli asks SCG crowd to roar after Mohammed Siraj sends Sam Konstas packing at SCG

Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

The second day of the fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG) showcased high-octane action as Mohammed Siraj took center stage with a remarkable bowling performance.

  • India scored a modest 185 runs in their first innings.
  • Siraj dismissed Sam Konstas and Travis Head in a game-changing over.
  • Virat Kohli energized the crowd by urging them to support the team.
  • Australia leads the series 2-1 and needs a win or draw to reclaim the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • India must win to level the series and retain the trophy.
“Kohli then turned to the crowd, waving his arms to fire them up, adding to the electrifying atmosphere at the SCG.”

This match is critical for both teams as they vie for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, reflecting their recent performances in Australia.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 2: Jasprit Bumrah Shatters 47-Year Old Record, Siraj Breathes Fire - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test, Day 2: Jasprit Bumrah Breaks Record

Date: Not specified Source: NDTV Sports

India is taking on Australia in the 5th Test and Jasprit Bumrah has recently shattered a significant record.

  • Live updates from the Test match between India and Australia.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's record-breaking performance highlighted.
  • Key moments and player performances tracked throughout the day.
"Jasprit Bumrah has delivered an exceptional performance that is worth noting in the annals of cricket history."

This match is crucial in the context of the series and both teams are looking to capitalize on every opportunity.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Creates History, Becomes 1st Indian Bowler To... - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Creates History, Becomes 1st Indian Bowler To...

Date: January 04, 2025 | Source: News18

World No. 1 Test bowler Jasprit Bumrah has made history by becoming the first Indian bowler to take 32 wickets in a Test series played away from home. This record was achieved during the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • Bumrah surpassed the previous record of 31 wickets held by Bishan Singh Bedi in the 1977-78 series in Australia.
  • He achieved this feat by dismissing Marnus Labuschagne for 2 runs in Sydney.
  • Bumrah has equalled Harbhajan Singh's record of 32 wickets in a Test series between India and Australia.
  • He has also made significant contributions with the bat in the ongoing match.
“One more wicket in the ongoing match will help Bumrah break Harbhajan’s 24-year-old record.”

Bumrah's achievement not only highlights his exceptional talent but also sets a new benchmark in Indian cricket.

item.title: ‘Reminds me of a young Kohli…’: Gavaskar dissects Sam Konstas’ altercation with Jasprit Bumrah, gives a Watson reminder - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gavaskar Comments on Konstas-Bumrah Altercation, Draws Kohli Comparison

Date: Jan 04, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The cricket community is buzzing after an on-field altercation between Sam Konstas and Jasprit Bumrah during the fifth Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test match. Sunil Gavaskar stated that Konstas' behavior reminded him of a young Virat Kohli.

  • Kohli's aggressive demeanor as a young player was highlighted in comparison to Konstas.
  • The altercation occurred in the final over of Day 1 with Bumrah responding to Konstas' remarks.
  • Gavaskar suggested that while such behavior can stir excitement, it’s risky and could lead to targeting from opponents.
  • Konstas is advised to manage his newfound aggressive image as it could impact his reputation.
“It’s not about the batting; it’s about what happens on the field when someone’s behaviour stirs things up... it reminds me of a young Kohli.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar warned that if Konstas continues to provoke, he will likely become a target for the opposing players.
